newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Telecom giants win lucrative Taiwan mobile rights.
newsitem.headline: Telecom giants win lucrative Taiwan mobile rights.

text.p: Taiwan on Monday awarded eight lucrative mobile phone franchises to local consortiums, most of them paired with global telecom giants as minority partners.

U.S. firms won big. One of two most coveted island-wide franchises, which permit their operators to deliver DCS mobile telephone service across Taiwan, was awarded to Taiwan's Far EastTone group, a partnership with AT&T Corp.
The second went to Pacific Telecommunications Systems, which links U.S.-based GTE Corp with Taiwan computer giant Acer Inc, Pacific Electric Wire & Cable and transport consortium Evergreen Marine.
The AT&T consortium also won a second, narrower licence for a region of the island, officials of the Ministry of Transport and Communications said after meetings late into the evening.

Other northern, central or southern franchises went to KG Telecom grouping U.S. firm Sprint with Taiwan's Koo's Group and Microelectronics Technology; Asia Pacific Investment Co linking U.S. firm SBC Corp with Taiwan's Formosa Plastics Group; and Mobitai, linked with the T-Mobil unite of Germany's Deutsche Telecom.
Two regional franchises went to Smartlink, a Taiwan firm led by giant Tuntex 2510.TW with no major high-tech partner.
